result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:57 PM Tyler Stephen Borgschatz appears in Court, DA Halle Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. DE called the PD's Office before court and he does qualify. DA Hatch is requesting to set a PH. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 4:04 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Current: 509 N. 7th Street, Lake City, MN 55041 United States  (Effective: 07-06-2022)
Prior: 509 N. 4th Street, Lake City, MN 55041 United States
DE from PCJ

3:15 PM Tyler Stephen Borgschatz appeared in custody  from Jail via video, ADA Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions non-appearance, he was in the hospital. ADA Walker is requesting a $500.00 cash bond w/conditions of Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service.  & Not to Operate a Motor Vehicle without a Valid Driver's License.  DE objects to cash bond. Court confirms address. Court will reinstate the bond, but if DE fails to appear cash will be ordered. Court will quash the warrant. DE does want a PD. Court adjourned at 3: pm.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Status conference on October 19, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.

3:04 PM Defendant Tyler Stephen Borgschatz appears from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson appears by phone, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walker is requesting a $25,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of AS, NTE & NTO, no objection. Court so orders. DE does not qualify for PD. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:13 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
